required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Association of Maternal Night-Eating Pattern With Glucose Tolerance During Pregnancy
clinical_study.official_title: The Association of Maternal Night-Eating Pattern With Glucose Tolerance During Pregnancy

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to assess the associations of maternal food timing with glucose levels during pregnancy.

detailed_description.textblock:
A novel line of research has emerged, suggesting that synchronizing the timing of food intake with body's circadian rhythms or day-night cycle has metabolic implications. Eating at the inappropriate time can disrupt circadian system which might induce metabolic perturbations, including glucose abnormalities. Recent evidence showed that circadian timing of eating was associated with glucose regulation in pregnant women. However, little is known about night-eating pattern during pregnancy, particularly the influence of nocturnal snacking on glycaemic control.
This cross-sectional study aims to recruit 400 pregnant women at 18-21 weeks' gestation. The investigators will assess maternal dietary intake, monitor 24-hour activity-rest pattern and light-dark exposure, and measure glucose and insulin profiles during the second trimester of pregnancy. Maternal socio-demographic status, lifestyle characteristics, health conditions and pregnancy outcomes will be asked through interview or retrieved from medical notes.
This study allows understanding the importance of circadian eating pattern, which is a modifiable behavior, in glycaemic control during pregnancy, and help to provide evidence for developing nutritional guidelines which can ameliorate metabolic health for mothers.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 weeks, during second trimester of pregnancy
primary_outcome.description: Maternal glucose tolerance based on plasma glucose levels as assessed by the Oral Glucose Tolerance Test.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 days, during second trimester of pregnancy
primary_outcome.description: Maternal night-eating pattern as assessed by the food diary and food record app.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 days, during second trimester of pregnancy
primary_outcome.description: Maternal meal and snack distribution as assessed by the food diary and food record app.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 weeks, during second trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal insulin profile as assessed by the fasting insulin level.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 4 weeks, during second trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal gestational diabetes status as assessed by the Oral Glucose Tolerance Test.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 10 days, during second trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal glycemic variability based on continuous glucose monitoring profile as assessed by the continuous glucose monitoring system (Freestyle Libre Pro, Abbott).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 month, during second trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal diet quality as assessed by the Food Frequency Questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 10 weeks, during second trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal type of food intake as assessed by the food diary, food record app and Food Frequency Questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 days, during second trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal nutritional intake as assessed by the food diary and food record app.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 days, during second trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal eating frequency as assessed by the food diary and food record app.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 month, during second trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal meal and snack regularity as assessed by the questionnaire based on frequency of meal/ snack delay and skipping.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 10 days, during second trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal physical activity as measured by the Actigraph accelerometer.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 week, during second trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal physical activity as assessed using the modified International Physical Activity Questionnaire (IPAQ).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 10 days, during second trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal sedentary behavior as measured by the Actigraph accelerometer.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 week, during second trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal sedentary behavior as assessed using the structured questionnaires based on frequency and duration of time spent in sedentary behaviour.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 10 days, during second trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal sleep related behaviour as measured by the Actigraph accelerometer.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 month, during second trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal sleep related behavior as assessed using the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 10 days, during second trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal light exposure as measured by the Actigraph accelerometer.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 week, during second trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal light exposure as assessed by the Harvard Light Exposure Assessment (H-LEA) questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal electronic media use before bedtime
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 week, during second trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal electronic media use before bedtime as assessed by the structured questionnaire based on frequency, duration and location of electronic device use.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 week, during second trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal mood as assessed by the Depression Anxiety Stress Scale (DASS21) questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 42 weeks, throughout pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal weight measured by calibrated weighing scale as recorded in medical notes

secondary_outcome.measure: Dietary data from food record app.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 4 days, during second trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Feasibility and validity of using food record mobile app to capture maternal dietary intake, compared with paper-based food diary.

other_outcome.description: Maternal hypertension status obtained from medical notes.
Maternal delivery outcomes obtained from medical notes.
Offspring birth weight in gram obtained from medical notes.
Offspring birth length in cm obtained from medical notes.
Offspring birth head circumference in cm obtained from medical notes.

study_pop.textblock: Healthy pregnant women aged 18-45 years old and at 18-21 weeks of gestation upon recruitment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. 18-21 week's gestation
2. Singapore citizens or Singapore Permanent Residents
3. Age 18-45 years
4. Plan to follow-up for antenatal care in KK Women's and Children's Hospital
5. Intend to deliver in KK Women's and Children's Hospital
6. Provide written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Type 1 or 2 diabetes
2. Diabetes in pregnancy as confirmed by oral glucose tolerance test
3. Use of medications such as anticonvulsant medications or oral steroids in the past 1 month
4. Multiple pregnancy
5. On routine night-shift work for at least 3x/week over the past 1 month
6. Known or suspected allergy to medical grade adhesives
7. Chronic kidney diseases
8. Preeclampsia
9. Eventual miscarriage or undergo termination event
